documents.document: President Trump, on the Senate nuclear option: "It's up to Mitch, but I would say go for it."
Good morning! Three am Twitter is the best Twitter of all, I think.
@IvanTheK : I received that press release at 9:16 pm, so yes.
@IvanTheK: interesting they had Rudy positioned with his back to the cameras, since it was his moment. Can't tell if that was intentional.
Lee Lofthus, AAG for Administration did the swearing in. Took place near Deputy Attorney General's office around 11pm.
I was curious about the circumstances of who swore in the new acting Attorney General last night, when and where. Here's what I was told:
@IvanTheK good question. I asked former NSA head Gen. Keith Alexander on air today, and he said POTUS simply wants to review everything.
WH says President Trump will not be signing the Executive Order on Cybersecurity right now, after all. Not clear when/if he will do it later
White House says President Trump will continue to enforece 2014 Exec Order protecting LGBT rights in the workplace.
@AlanTonelson @nytimes : yes, to be clear, Obama did start to do it toward the end. But early on they were really on message.
White House appears to be testing the video and audio for the new "Skype seats" for out of town reporters to ask qu… https://t.co/LB5HQ0ieos
@MarkMelin @kaylatausche @CNBC @talkingbiznews : DC is * better* than New York. No question. #confessyourunpopularopinion
Another standing-room-only crowd for Sean Spicer's upcoming White House briefing. Stand by for news! https://t.co/hSSJE5odkb
@kaylatausche @CNBC @talkingbiznews: congrats and welcome to the bureau! DC is just like New York, only smaller.
They will score all of these regs based on impact to the economy and create a new budgetary process for totaling up economic costs of Regs.
Sr. Adm official says each agency head responsible for identifying two Regs to eliminate for each new one. Total dollar impact for FY'17= 0.
Blankfein also says: "we will work to minimize such disruption to the extent we can within the law."
Lloyd voicemail to Goldman employees on Trump EO: "there is potential for disruption to the firm, and especially to some of our people"
Last night from the White House for NBC's terrific Steve Handelsman, who is calling it a career tomorrow. A real pr… https://t.co/3Jx16T14Mo
4. Another concern: if you bring manufacturing back to the US, how much would be people and how much would be robots in this day and age?
3. Their challenge is to bring big pieces of the global supply chain - parts, suppliers, etc - back to the US. But without increasing prices
2. That is, the CEOs felt any action that increases costs for consumers would be a bad outcome.
Speaking of an import tax.. I'm told the manufacturing CEOs at WH this week focused on ensuring any WH action "increases competitiveness".
And POTUS has left the White House. https://t.co/kG8NKHTNR6
Awaiting President Trump's first departure on Marine One here at the White House now. https://t.co/hOBZkJbLjT
@IvanTheK @CNBC : those guys are awesome.
Thrilled to have @MichaelDell as a new follower this morning. Michael, please DM me all details of the WH meeting this week...
@IvanTheK : I know you depend on me for this type of shrewd market analysis.
20k is a lot of k.
@SilviaBerzoni : yes. But check the tape!
@SilviaBerzoni : I asked him what his company would do differently under President Trump than it would have done otherwise.
I'm jumping on @SquawkCNBC momentarily. You should watch, or you might miss something.
If we're talking crowd sizes, this could be a record for White House briefing room. I can't remember the room this packed during Obama yrs.
Absolutely packed here in the White House briefing room for Sean Spicer's first press briefing today... https://t.co/L9b6CccGI7
Just spoke to Kevin Plank of Under Armor at White House. Said he wasn't given agenda for Trump mtg. He's here bc "I'm a good American."
Just spoke to Andrew Liveris of Dow on way into West Wing. He said he's not here to make specific jobs news. Said "we're here to listen."
Just saw @elonmusk walking in the West Wing here at the White House ahead of the 9 am CEO meeting.
@ReformedBroker @alastairjam @chucktodd : Kurt Cobain said all he was trying to do was write a Pixies song.
@ReformedBroker @alastairjam @chucktodd : Pixies: Best band ever? Or just best band of all time?
@j_hsieh @CNBC : thanks, JH! I love a big news day.
Rule of thumb: when covering riot on live TV + overcome by burning car smoke, seek refuge in nearest ...hair salon. https://t.co/g44JCze9AO
@TheDomino as you know, @mattcuddy is the man. Also amazing to work with today: @PAnastasi, Pat P, @Kj_Sloan, @briabrie, + Ashley Stringer
@louisvelazquez: thanks, Louis. It was a little rowdy out there today.
@CramersShirt: They appear to have a nostalgic take on the Soviet Union.
@CramersShirt: this is the middle of the street. Road totally blocked. Police and National Guard standing by. They're letting it burn now.
Here's the scene now at 14th and K. Protestors have the fires going again. https://t.co/44wslqWmdX
Army vehicles now rolling alongside the protests here at 14th street. https://t.co/RQ65AuqS0A
This is the limo that just went up in flames on K street in DC. Protestors smashed it up and then someone torched i… https://t.co/mPiqMoBQEr
@kaylatausche : this is Jeremy from Salon 180 , who is taking in people who need fresh air and water here. https://t.co/ijEfdo2hpR
@SteveKopack : to be clear, we see TV gear in the vehicle with FoxNews stickers. Don't know who owns vehicle.
@shauner @CNBC : thanks. *Almost* everyone out here is very well behaved.
@Sarge986 @TheDomino @mattcuddy : thanks. We're all good here. Just a couple people who wanted to try out a few new words today.
@techanalysis : thanks. Just a couple of rowdies out here.
DC Metropolitan police have the intersection of 13th and K well under control now. https://t.co/Npadj55HJ2
"The President's Own" US Marine Corps band taking their seats now. https://t.co/COFkJ4bgF6
And the rain comes early. Ponchos coming out all across the national mall.
@IvanTheK : yes and all the other TV crews. It's shoulder to shoulder on our platform.
@IvanTheK they're not calling for rain now until 11. And of course we can't use umbrellas up here...
Crowd is starting to fill in on the Mall - hours before the swearing in. https://t.co/Ro5RGNSG28
Earlier tweet was the beautiful view we get from up here. But here's what the west front looks like behind the scen… https://t.co/lgWVKwSSZ1
Good morning from the West Front of the Capitol. Beautiful cool morning so far for Donald Trump's #Inauguration. https://t.co/ZZzx4vhNsc
Up and at 'em and ready for a big day. I'll be on the WestFront of the Capitol at 7 am and straight through the swearing in.
Mnuchin says the most troubling loan he had was to the "octomom", and he worked very hard to move her to another home.
Mnuchin says he would handle Trump's business the same way he would handle other businesses on the committee on foreign investment in US.
Wyden first question to Mnuchin is on repeal of Obamacare and Medicare solvency.
Mnuchin hearing opens with fireworks as Sen. Roberts tells Sen. Wyden to take a Valium. Dems get hackles up about the insult.
Road closures already in place in DC core this morning . Today's rush hour is going to be rough for people coming in later.
Obama, answering last Q of presidency, on his family and Trump elex: "The only thing that is the end of the world is the end of the world."
Wilbur Ross says he fired a household employee within the last month after that employee was unable to provide proof of legal status to work
Paul Ryan on Manning: “This is just outrageous. Chelsea Manning’s treachery put American lives at risk ..."
Sr. Administration Official says POTUS decision to grant clemency to Manning not influenced by public comments from Assange or Wikileaks.
Also pardoned by Obama today: James Edward Cartwright – Gainesville, VA Offense: False statements to federal investigators
@MCaruso_Cabrera @realDonaldTrump : He'll have a nicer one next week.
COO of Don's Johns on @CNBC now to talk about his company's logos being taped over on inaugural port-a-potties.
@morningmoneyben: I don't think that was in dispute, was it?
Obama appoints Valerie Jarrett+Susan Rice to Kennedy Center board,soccer star Carli Lloyd and Kareem Abdul Jabbar to Prez council on fitness
Doubletake email of the day from the outgoing WH staff: "President Obama Announces More Key Administration Posts"
@OneJaxson : send me those documents, man. I'd love to see them . Who is your family?
@OneJaxson: looks like you have access to docs I didn't have. Tell me what you know.
@kenvogel : unless Client A doesn't know what's being sold to Client B, or gives it a wink and a nod.
@kenvogel: by that standard, working thee same side of the case for two different clients wd not feel like a conflict.
@kenvogel : not sure that's the case. I know private intel firms that have worked BOTH sides of a case at the same time. Clients don't know
@frankthorp He said bottom.
Steve Harvey suggests he might not get involved in politics full time: "I ain't going to pass a background check."
Donald Trump appearing with Steve Harvey now at Trump Tower.

DOJ IG to look into: Allegations FBI’s release of certain FOIA docs on Oct 30 and Nov 1, 2016 were influenced by improper considerations
DOJ IG will look into: allegations that Assistant AG for Legislative Affairs improperly disclosed non-public information to Clinton campaign
DOJ IG will look into: "Allegations that the FBI Deputy Director should have been recused"
DOJ IG to look into: "FBI Director’s public announcement on July 5, 2016 +the Director’s letters to Congress on October 28+November 6, 2016"
Brian Fallon, former Clinton press secretary, says he believes FBI Director James Comey's actions were decisive in tilting election to Trump
CIA nominee Pompeo says CIA workforce is "very much looking forward to the new administration."
CIA nominee Pompeo says he would not follow an order from Trump to restart "enhanced interrogation." Says can't imagine Trump would order it
CIA confirmation hearing back up and running in new hearing room now. https://t.co/0aYbDnSXFx
